TopicTitle: Any way to adjust multi-directional thrusters?

Articles.Content: I was thinking of designing a ship based on the Eagles from the old show Space 1999. I want the main thrusters on the bottom like a normal rocket but I also want 'adjustable' thrusters on the back. I know I can put the thrusters on a custom action and turn them on and off but is there any way to make them adjustable so I can adjust the speed level on the second axis?

I didn't understand quite well, but if I got what You mean, try using LSHIFT+W/A/S/D/Q/E ( Hold shift and press on any of these buttons )

If that's what you wanted, let us know.

I know I can put the thrusters on a custom action and turn them on and off but is there any way to make them adjustable so I can adjust the speed level on the second axis?

No, your throttle controls the thrust for all active engines.
You could "modulate" the thrusters by switching the action group off and on really fast. That seems kerbal enough.
